Uses of Interface
com.codepoetics.fluvius.api.Flow

  • Packages that use Flow 
    Package Description
    com.codepoetics.fluvius.api
    Provides the top-level Fluvius API.
    com.codepoetics.fluvius.describers
    Defines a FlowVisitor which constructs a FlowDescription from a Flow, and a PrettyPrintingDescriptionWriter which can pretty-print it to a String.
    com.codepoetics.fluvius.flows
    Provides the fluent Flow-creation and execution API, for which the public entry-point is the Flows class.

    • Uses of Flow in com.codepoetics.fluvius.api

      Methods in com.codepoetics.fluvius.api that return Flow 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Flow<T> Flow.orIf(Condition condition, Flow<T> ifTrue)
      Create a branching Flow, with this Flow as the default branch and the supplied Condition and Flow as the first conditional branch.
      <N> Flow<N> Flow.then(Flow<N> next)
      Combine this Flow with a subsequent Flow to create a sequence of Flows.
      Methods in com.codepoetics.fluvius.api with parameters of type Flow 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Flow<T> Flow.orIf(Condition condition, Flow<T> ifTrue)
      Create a branching Flow, with this Flow as the default branch and the supplied Condition and Flow as the first conditional branch.
      <N> Flow<N> Flow.then(Flow<N> next)

      static FlowDescription FlowDescriber.describe(Flow<?> flow)

    • Uses of Flow in com.codepoetics.fluvius.flows

      Methods in com.codepoetics.fluvius.flows that return Flow 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Flow<T> BranchBuilder.otherwise(Flow<T> defaultFlow)
      Completes the construction of the branching Flow by specifying the default Flow to execute if none of its conditions are met.
      Flow<OUTPUT> SourceTargetCapture1.using(F1<A,OUTPUT> f1)
      Create a Flow from the source key to the target key, using the given function.
      Flow<OUTPUT> SourceTargetCapture2.using(F2<A,B,OUTPUT> f2)
      Create a Flow from the source keys to the target key, using the given function.
      Flow<OUTPUT> SourceTargetCapture3.using(F3<A,B,C,OUTPUT> f3)
      Create a Flow from the source keys to the target key, using the given function.
      Flow<T> OutputKeysCapture.using(Operation<T> operation)
      Create a Flow which processes the captured input keys using the given Operation, and writes the result into the capture output key.
      Flow<OUTPUT> SourceTargetCapture1.using(String name, F1<A,OUTPUT> f1)
      Create a Flow from the source key to the target key, using the given name and function.
      Flow<OUTPUT> SourceTargetCapture2.using(String name, F2<A,B,OUTPUT> f2)
      Create a Flow from the source keys to the target key, using the given name and function.
      Flow<OUTPUT> SourceTargetCapture3.using(String name, F3<A,B,C,OUTPUT> f3)
      Create a Flow from the source keys to the target key, using the given name and function.
      Flow<T> OutputKeysCapture.using(String name, ScratchpadFunction<T> function)
      Create a Flow which processes the captured input keys using the given ScratchpadFunction, and writes the result into the capture output key.
      Methods in com.codepoetics.fluvius.flows with parameters of type Flow 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> BranchBuilder<T> Flows.branch(Condition condition, Flow<T> ifTrue)
      Start defining a branching flow, beginning with the supplied Condition and Flow to execute if the condition is met.
      BranchBuilder<T> BranchBuilder.orIf(Condition condition, Flow<T> ifTrue)
      Adds a conditional branch to the BranchBuilder, using the supplied Condition and Flow to execute if the Condition is met.
      Flow<T> BranchBuilder.otherwise(Flow<T> defaultFlow)
      Completes the construction of the branching Flow by specifying the default Flow to execute if none of its conditions are met.
      static String Flows.prettyPrint(Flow<?> flow)
      Obtain a pretty-printed string representation of the supplied Flow.
      static <T> T Flows.run(Flow<T> flow, FlowVisitor<Action> flowVisitor, KeyValue... keyValues)
      Run the supplied Flow, using the given FlowVisitor to construct an execution plan, providing it with an initial Scratchpad containing the given key values.
      static <T> T Flows.run(Flow<T> flow, FlowVisitor<Action> flowVisitor, Scratchpad initialScratchpad)
      Run the supplied Flow, using the given FlowVisitor to construct an execution plan, providing it with the given initial Scratchpad.
